meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a lock.
meanings.sent1: She was locking the door before leaving the house.
meanings.sent2: Remember to always locking your bike when you park it outside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was locking its nuts in a tiny safe.
meanings.sent4: His gaze was locking onto her, as if trying to memorize every detail.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the key locking the treasure chest echoed in the cave.

meanings.definition: To become fixed or immovable in place.
meanings.sent1: The rust caused the gears to start locking up.
meanings.sent2: The wheels of the car were locking due to the icy road.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces kept locking together perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His fear was locking him in place, unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The vines were locking the gate shut, preventing anyone from entering.

meanings.definition: A mechanism for keeping a door, lid, etc., fastened.
meanings.sent1: The old chest had a rusty locking mechanism.
meanings.sent2: She found the key to the locking on the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The locking on the box was so intricate, it took him a while to figure it out.
meanings.sent4: The locking on the gate clicked shut, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The locking on the suitcase was broken, making it impossible to secure.
